monogr.title: The Innes of Court anagrammatist: or, The masquers masqued in anagrammes : Expressed in epigramique lines, upon their severall names, set downe in the next page. Composed by Francis Lenton Gent. one of her Majesties poets
monogr.author: Lenton, Francis

keywords.term: Adages, aphorisms, emblem books, jests, proverbs

div.head: In commendation of the Authors late ELEGIE, and present ANAGRAMS.
div.l: WHo vayl'd in blackes, Melpomene's sad face,
Trips now with Erato in a masquing pace:
You that would reade a lamentable straine,
His dying Swan, behold with Royall Chaine:
Gentiles, if Here you laugh, it is enough,
His Muse (he sweares) dispatcht it with a puffe.
